Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in its natural water habitat.
The student can label the water as a resource needed by the fish to survive.
The student can include and label other living things in the fish's habitat, such as plants or other animals.
The student can show and label other resources found in the water habitat, like rocks or plants.
The student can illustrate how the fish interacts with water as part of its survival needs.
The student can demonstrate through drawing that the water habitat is a system where many parts work together.
